intro: Hedyotis ramarowii var. ramarowii, commonly known as the narrowleaf bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many flowering plants known for their small, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, narrow, and slightly hairy, while its small white flowers appear in clusters. It is valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
